RamNode – 10 offers- $13.92 128MB SSD VPS in Atlanta, Seattle or Netherlands

atlanta, netherlands, seattle September 23, 2013 @ 10:38 am, by Liam

Nick, from RamNode, has got ten different offers for us. They are offering 42% off for life on all VPS plans with the code NOWAY42 (upgrades or new orders ONLY). Click ‘more’ to see the 8 others plans we received.

128MB OpenVZ SSD

  • 128MB RAM
  • 128MB vSwap
  • 1 CPU Core
  • 5GB RAID10 SSD Diskspace
  • 500GB Bandwidth @ 1Gbps
  • 1 IPv4 Address
  • 16 IPv6 Addresses
  • OpenVZ & SolusVM
  • $13.92/Year ($1.16/Month)
  • Order: Atlanta, GA
  • Order: Seattle, WA
  • Order: Netherlands
128MB OpenVZ SSD-Cached

  • 128MB RAM
  • 128MB vSwap
  • 1 CPU Core
  • 50GB RAID10 SSD-Cached Disk
  • 500GB Bandwidth @ 1Gbps
  • 1 IPv4 Address
  • 16 IPv6 Addresses
  • OpenVZ & SolusVM
  • $13.92/Year ($1.16/Month)
  • Order: Atlanta, GA
  • Order: Seattle, WA
  • Order: Netherlands

Atlanta based RamNode LLC have been featured on LowEndBox many times before. RamNode are using Intel Ivy and Sandy Bridge Processors, Samsung, Intel, and Kingston SSDs, WD and Seagate Enterprise HDDs, LSI RAID cards. They recently came first in our 2013 Q1 Top Providers poll. They had previously came second and third in previous polls.. Since we last listed RamNode, they have expanded to Netherlands following the acquisition of TrueVPS. RamNode are now also offering DDoS-filtered IPs at their Seattle location for $3/month.

RamNode accept payments via PayPal and Google Wallet. Refunds are offered with 3 days of your first invoice on your first service. Nothing illegal in the US or anything that is disruptive is allowed. Adult, Tor (Relays only; No exit nodes), IRC and VPN is allowed. TUN/TAP–PPP is available. They offer free cPanel DNS hosting and cPanel/WHM VPS licenses for $13/mo. You can view their OS list here. Take a look at their Terms of Service and Acceptable Usage Policy before signing up

Network Information

RamNode own their own IPs and have their own ARIN ASN: AS3842 (http://bgp.he.net/AS3842). They have Tinet and nLayer in both US locations (Cogent as well in Atlanta). They have our own rack in Dataplace in The Netherlands.
